intro: Dodecatheon conjugens subsp. leptophyllum, commonly known as the slenderleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
